queue.fact_text: In 1941, during World War II’s North African campaign, British and Commonwealth troops captured Tobruk from Italian forces as part of Operation Compass. The port became a symbol of stubborn resistance and logistics ingenuity in a war fought across harsh desert landscapes.

queue.fact_text: On this day in 1968, the U.S. began installing Operation Igloo White, an electronic sensor network to track movement along the Ho Chi Minh trail. queue.fact_text: In 1992, rebel forces in Zaire seized the national radio station in Kinshasa and used it to broadcast demands for the government’s resignation. For a brief moment, the state’s own loudspeaker turned into a megaphone for dissent.

episode.title: Morning Drops #44 - Residente
episode.description:
In this edition of Morning Drops, Yasmin navigates the complex geography of René Pérez Joglar, known to the world as Residente. His story is not just a musical evolution; it is a timeline marked by resistance, lyrical obsession, and a relentless search for identity.

From the gated streets of Trujillo Alto to the global stage, we explore how a restless mind transformed into the voice of a generation. The selection moves through the textures of his life: hearing the raw energy of his early rebellion, the sharp precision of his political critique, and finally, the fragile silence of his most personal confessions.

It is a study in duality. We witness the rapper who dismantles giants and the son who misses his mother. It is a soundscape that proves that sometimes, the loudest revolution happens inside.

Mood: Raw, Revolutionary, Introspective, Honest
Music genre: Latin Alternative, Hip Hop, Urban, World

queue.fact_text: In 1999, Australian missionary Graham Staines and his two young sons were burned alive while sleeping in their car in eastern India, attacked by a mob of extremist Hindus. The brutal murder shocked India and the world, sparking debates about religious tolerance, justice, and forgiveness.

episode.title: Morning Drops #42 - The Joy Of Learning
episode.description:
Hosted by Yasmin, this Morning Drop explores learning as a lifelong process, focusing on persistence, repetition, and the emotional landscape that comes with challenging oneself over time.

Through personal stories and scientific insights, the episode looks at how learning reshapes the brain, generates joy through effort, and why progress often arrives after confusion and frustration. It reflects on the so-called delayed pleasure effect, the role of dopamine in motivation, and how curiosity and learning support long-term wellbeing.

The episode also questions our cultural relationship with failure and invites a softer, more realistic approach to learning, one that accepts mistakes as part of growth and sees persistence as a quiet form of strength.

Mood: reflective, grounded, quietly hopeful
Music genre: alternative rock, hip hop, electronic, neo-soul, drill

A space to listen slowly and stay with the process.
